title: The Shield of CPR
text: When the King is attacked, remember CPR: Capture the attacker, Protect with a shield, or Run away. Look for the capture first.

title: The Back Rank Trap
text: When a King is trapped behind his own pawns, a rook on the eighth rank is checkmate. The pawns that protect him become his prison.

title: The Gift of Breath
text: When you are winning, leave your opponent one legal move. If he has no moves but is not in check, the game is a draw—stalemate.

title: The Forked Road
text: A good move solves one problem. A great move creates two problems for your opponent at once. Knights and pawns are the masters of the fork.

title: The Iron Nail
text: A pinned piece is not really a piece. It is a shield. Do not be romantic about it. Attack it again and again until the shield breaks.

title: The Burning Line
text: In a skewer, the King stands in front and the treasure hides behind. Set the line on fire; first the King runs, then the treasure dies.

title: The Rule of the Square
text: If your King can step inside the box from pawn to promotion, the pawn is dead. If he cannot, do not chase—race with your own pawn instead.

title: The Iron Opposition
text: In King endgames, the side who does not move often has the advantage. Stand in front of his King with one square between you and say: 'Your move, my friend.'

title: The Bodyguard King
text: Your King is not a spectator. First he walks in front of the pawn, then the pawn walks to glory. If the pawn runs alone, both may die.
